name: Texture
comment: This is a broad, not very well defined category for units that seem to look for simple local structures over a wide receptive field, including mixtures of colors.

name: Color Center-Surround
comment: These units look for one color in the center, and another color surrounding it. These units likely have many subtleties about the range of hues, texture preferences, and interactions that similar neurons in earlier layers may not have. Note how many units detect the absence (or generic presence) of color, building off of the black and white detectors in mixed3a. Compare to earlier Color Center-Surround (conv2d2) and (Color Center-Surround mixed3a).

name: Complex Center-Surround
comment: This is a broad, not very well defined category for center-surround units that detect a pattern or complex texture in their center.

name: Brightness Gradients
comment: These units detect brightness gradients. This is their third iteration; compare to earlier brightness gradients (conv2d2) and brightness gradients (mixed3a).

name: Generic, Oriented Fur
comment: We don't typically think of fur as an oriented feature, but it is. These units detect fur parting in various ways, much like how hair on your head parts.

name: Eyes
comment: Again, we continue to see eye detectors quite early in vision. Note that several of these detect larger eyes than the earlier eye detectors (mixed3a). In the next layer, we see much larger scale eye detectors again.

name: Circle Cluster
comment: Units detecting circles and curves without necesarily requiring spatial coherrence.

name: Boundary
comment: These units use multiple cues to detect the boundaries of objects. They vary in orientation, detecting convex/concave/straight boundaries, and detecting artificial vs fur foregrounds. Cues they rely on include line detectors, high-low frequency detectors, and color contrast.

name: Curves
comment:
The third iteration of curve detectors. They detect larger radii curves than their predecessors, and are the first to not slightly fire for curves rotated 180 degrees. Compare to the earlier curves (conv2d2) and curves (mixed3a).

A detailed article on these is forthcoming.

name: Double Curves
comment: Weights appear to be two curve detectors added together. Likely best thought of as a polysemantic neuron.

name: Curves misc.
comment: Low confidence organizational category.

name: Shallow Curves
comment: Detectors for curves with wider radii than regular curve detectors.

name: Curve Shapes
comment: Simple shapes created by composing curves, such as spirals and S-curves.

name: Divots
comment: Curve-like detectors for sharp corners or bumps.

name: Cross / Corner Divergence
comment: Units detecting lines crossing or diverging from a center point. Some are early predecessors for 3D corner detection.

name: Square / Grid
comment: Units detecting grid patterns.

name: Evolute
comment: Detects curves facing away from the middle. Opposite of circles. Term repurposed from mathematical evolutes which can sometimes be visually similar.

name: Circles / Loops
comment: Piece together curves in a circle or partial circle. Opposite of evolute.

name: Columns
comment: We don't really understand these units.

name: Scales
comment: We don't really understand these units.

name: Proto-Head
comment: The tiny eye detectors, along with texture detectors for fur, hair and skin developed at the previous layer enable these early head detectors, which will continue to be refined in the next layer.

name: Bumps
comment: Low confidence category.

name: Color Contrast/Gradient
comment: Units which respond to different colors on each side. These units look for one color in the center, and another color surrounding it. These units likely have many subtleties about the range of hues, texture preferences, and interactions that similar neurons in earlier layers may not have. Compare to earlier color contrast (conv2d0, conv2d1, conv2d2, mixed3a).

name: Bar / Line-Like
comment: Low confidence category.

name: Boundary Misc Last Resort
comment: Boundary-related units we didn't know what else to do with.

name: Star
comment: Low confidence category.

name: Pointy
comment: Low confidence category.

name: Texture Contrast
comment: Units that detect one texture on one side and a different texture on the other.

name: Other Units
comment: Units that don't fall in any other category.
